answers.answer: I've had that in my first pregnancy (last year) and it luckily didnt lead to me getting pre-eclampsia, but, it did make my doctor decide to induce me at 38 weeks since I had already gone into pre term labor at 36 weeks. Unfortunately, my blood pressure did also result in me having to go to the obgyn more frequently than most preggy women for ultrasounds and stress test at the hospital to ensure the safety of baby and I.Best wishes and congrats on the pregnancy. ..you and baby will be fine, so, try not to worry much...baby will definitely get to develop until full term at least.
Yes. I had preeclampsia with my first. They had me coming in for no stress tests until 37 weeks, then decided to induce me
I did the 24-hour collection and bloodwork. I was fine. Delivered baby when she was ready. Try to relax.

I'm 38 weeks tomorrow and was planning on induction next Thursday anyways so wasn't sure with my BP being 159/95 today and this extra blood work and 24 hr collection meant anything. I'm dilated to 3cm already.

yes I suffer from chronic high blood pressure I'm 39 years old and pregnant with my first child my youngest child is two years old came Do to pre-eclampsia because of my high blood pressure however I did not take my medication like I was supposed to this time I'm on top of things I'm taking my blood pressure medication like I should I'm also continuing to exercise and make every doctors appointment.

I'm 33 weeks and 4 days! I'm 43yrs old and have high blood pressure! My doctor is inducing me at 38 weeks b/c of that! Plus I also have gestational diabetes which I take medicine for! Plus I'm doing non stress test twice a week!

I had BP values in the medium 140's / 80-90's with my first but no signs of protein in my urine.  I had weekly non- stress tests, was asked to work part time, and was induced at 39 weeks.If your tests results come back abnormal it is entirely possible you will be induced earlier than planned - preeclampsia is nothing to mess around with (if that is what is going on)

question: Has anyone had HIGH blood pressure 2 appointments in a row and had to do blood work and a 24hr urine collection?Did it result in delivering right away due to possibly having preeclampsia??
title: SCaREd
